channel.title: Penn State Cru Talks
channel.itunes:author: Penn State Cru
channel.itunes:keywords: God, henderson, crusade, campus, christianity, religion, hersh, bible, pennsylvania, spirituality, college, crew
channel.description: Penn State Cru is a community where the gospel captures hearts, transforms lives, and launches men and women into a lifelong adventure with Jesus Christ. Cru meets every Thursday night at 7:05pm in the HUB movie theater at Penn State University. The talks podcast is updated every week during fall and spring semester with the latest talks from the weekly meeting. For more info, check out pennstatecru.org. Intro music is taken from "Orthodox Pleasure" by Bit Rationale. Outro music is taken from "Mohave Metro" by cjacks.

item.title: Thrive or Survive the Summer
item.author: webmaster@pennstatecru.org (Tim Henderson)
item.itunes:author: Mark Hough
item.description: Mark discusses the spiritual challenges the summer presents, and helps by proposing three key things to keep in mind when trying to prepare for this summer.
item.itunes:subtitle: Mark discusses the spiritual challenges the summer presents, and helps by proposing three key things to keep in mind when trying to prepare for this summer.

item.title: Our Deep Brokenness and Jesus' Atonement
item.author: webmaster@pennstatecru.org (Tim Henderson)
item.itunes:author: Dan Silverstein
item.description: Dan talks about overcoming hard times not by working harder, but by recognizing and finding more joy in the fact that Jesus sacrificed himself to take away our sin.
item.itunes:subtitle: Dan talks about overcoming hard times not by working harder, but by recognizing and finding more joy in the fact that Jesus sacrificed himself to take away our sin.

item.title: Our Longing For Approval
item.author: webmaster@pennstatecru.org (Tim Henderson)
item.itunes:author: Ed Hanna
item.description: Looking at the Parable of the Pharisee and the Tax Collector, Ed discusses our desire for approval and how we need to recognize God's approval if we are to get better from the inside-out.
item.itunes:subtitle: Looking at the Parable of the Pharisee and the Tax Collector, Ed discusses our desire for approval and how we need to recognize God's approval if we are to get better from the inside-out.

item.title: Glory of God is Creation
item.author: webmaster@pennstatecru.org (Tim Henderson)
item.itunes:author: Tim Henderson
item.description: Tim shows that with the use of a telescope, microscope, and even the naked eye, we are able to see the power and beauty of our God.
item.itunes:subtitle: Tim shows that with the use of a telescope, microscope, and even the naked eye, we are able to see the power and beauty of our God.

item.title: Radical Obedience
item.author: webmaster@pennstatecru.org (Tim Henderson)
item.itunes:author: Leonard Eyster
item.description: Leonard, a graduate from Penn State, previous member of Penn State Cru and Lieutenant in the United States Army, discusses the difficulties of living in full obedience to Christ.
item.itunes:subtitle: Leonard, a graduate from Penn State, previous member of Penn State Cru and Lieutenant in the United States Army, discusses the difficulties of living in full obedience to Christ.

item.title: Uncovering Shame
item.author: webmaster@pennstatecru.org (Tim Henderson)
item.itunes:author: Joel Shibata
item.description: Joel looks at the origin of shame, looks at our response to shame, and shows how even in our failures, we can feel freedom through Christ.
item.itunes:subtitle: Joel looks at the origin of shame, looks at our response to shame, and shows how even in our failures, we can feel freedom through Christ.

item.title: Wingspan :: Four Surprising Responses

item.itunes:author: Tim Henderson
item.description: The Wingspan series is concluded with Tim's look at Paul's radical and "backwards" love demonstrated in Acts 16.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Wingspan series is concluded with Tim's look at Paul's radical and "backwards" love demonstrated in Acts 16.

item.itunes:subtitle: The Wingspan series is continued as Tom looks at the connection in John 2 between the anger Jesus demonstrates in the temple and how it emphasizes his passionate love for us.

item.itunes:subtitle: Tim, with the help of Andy Garrison, demonstrates that truly loving others in their physical pains and sufferings leads to sharing the story of Jesus' love for them.
